shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 3ra-20va) II) Qǝddase zä-ʾabäwinä liqawǝnt zä-Gǝbḍ “The Mass of Our Fathers, the Elders of Egypt” (fol. 20va-48ra) III) Anaphoras (fols. 48ra-139rb) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 48ra-61vb) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 62va-65va), preceded by an excerpt from the “The Book of the Testament” (fols. 61vb-62va) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 65va-74vb) III-4) Anaphora of St. John, son of Thunder (fols. 74vb-82vb) III-5) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 83ra-88ra) III-6) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 88ra-90va) III-7) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 90va-96ra) III-8) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 96ra-101va) III-9) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 101va-107ra) III-10) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 107ra-114ra) III-11) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 114ra-123vb) III-12) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 124ra-131va) III-13) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 131va-137ra) III-14) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 137ra-139rb)
Additiones 1-9.

donors.donor: Wälättä Kidan (s. donation note, Additio 4). Supplication formulas within the text also mention Ḥabtä Mikaʾel, Täklä Mikaʾel, Wäldä Maryam.

owners.owner: Qalätay (according to Additio 2, he owned the Ms. for some time).

dcomments.dcomment: Fol. 42va: Mǝnilǝk is mentioned as the ruling King. Fols. 48rb, 66va, etc.: Qerǝllos is mentioned as the Patriarch and Matewos as the Metropolitan. Fol. 96rb: Ṗeṭros is mentioned as the Patriarch. Mǝnilǝk II was the Emperor of Ethiopia in 1889-1913. Cyril V was the Patriarch of Alexandria in 1874-1927. Matewos was the Metropolitan of Ethiopia in 1889-1926. The name of Ṗeṭros is mentioned for unclear reasons.

txstates.txstate: Many leaves are stained with dirt. Fols. 51and 112 were cut and mended with the help of parchment strips.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: cross hatching, criss-cross, double circle, triple line fillet).

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(6/fols. 35r-40v) – VI(8/fols. 41r-48v) – VII(10/fols. 49r-58v) – VIII(10/fols. 59r-68v) – IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – X(10/fols. 77r-86v) – XI(10/s. l.: 4, 7, stubs after 3, 6/fols. 87r-96v) – XII(10/fols. 97r-106v) – XIII(10/fols. 107r-116v) – XIV(8/fols. 117r-124v) – XV(10/fols. 125r-134v) – XVI(4/fols. 135r-138v) – XVII(2/fols. 139r-140v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are mostly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Fluent, tending to elaboration, of uneven quality throughout the Ms.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the ruling King, Patriarch and Metropolitan; incipits and headings of the constituent texts; directives for the ministers; musical notation signs above the lines; most of the abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numbers.
Incipits of some of the constituent texts are written alternately in red and black letters (s. fols. 48ra, 83ra, 107ra, etc.).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ or ካሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቡራ፡ for ቡራኬ፡ እማ፡ for እማሬ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እግዚ(አብ)፡ for እግዚአብሔር፡ እግ፡ ተሣ፡ for እግዚኦ፡ ተሣሀለነ፡ ና፡ ከ፡ እ፡ for ናስተበቍዕ፡ ከመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጸሎ፡ for ጸሎተ፡ በእን፡ for በእንተ፡ ወእም፡ for ወእምዝ፡ ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ሠራ፡ for ሠራዊተ፡ ዘማቴ፡ for ዘማቴዎስ፡ ዘማር፡ for ዘማርቆስ፡ ዘዮሐን፡ for ዘዮሐንስ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: The text Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass”, present in most Ethiopic Missals, is not singled out in this Ms. Instead, a special text unit entitled Qǝddase zä-ʾabäwinä liqawǝnt zä-Gǝbḍ “The Mass of Our Fathers, the Elders of Egypt” begins on fol. 20va, which is signalled both by rubrication and by an ornamental frame. The Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (text III-2) is not inscribed. In the Anaphora of Our Lady (text III-3), only the purported authorship (“of St. Cyriacus, bishop of the town of Behnesa”) is indicated. The text at the beginning of fol. 34ra has been enclosed in an oval and the same text begun anew on the verso side of the folio. Part of the text on fol. 18rb (from l.7 down to the end of the column) is apparently written in a different hand.

additional.add: Fol. 2r: የዚህ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ጌታ፡ ስሙ፡ ቃለታይ፡ አባቱ፡ ኪዳኑ፡ ጕርዲ፡ እናቱ፡ ወዘሮ፡ ኪሮስ፡ አገሩ፡ ማይ፡ [ወ]ወይን፡ ታቦቱ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ነው፡ የተገዛበት፡ በሃያ፡ ሁለት፡ ብር፡ በ፲፱ለኅዳር፡ በዘመነ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ በንጉሥ፡ ሚካኤል፡ መንግሥት፡ በራስ፡ ሥዩም፡ መሳፍንንት (sic)፡ ዳኛው፡ መምህር፡ ገብረ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ መቀሌ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት።
Fol. 2r: ዛቲመጽፍ (sic)፡ ዘታቦተ፡ ማርያም፡ ሠግላት፡ ገዳመ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ነገሥት፡ ገብረ፡ መስቀል
additional.tran: [Fol. 2r]: This is a book of the tabot of Mary (of) Śäglat, the monastery of the king of kings Gäbrä Mäsqäl.
additional.det: Written under Additio 2 in a different ink and in smaller letters.

additional.add: Fol. 2v: ዝቅዳሴ፡ ዘቤተ፡ ማርያም፡ ሰግላት፡ ዘወሐበታ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወለተ፡ ኪዳን፡ ከመይኵና፡ መርሐ፡ ለመን[ግ]ሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ዘሰረቃ፡ ወዘፈሐቋ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ።
additional.tran: [Fol. 2v]: This is a book of Betä Maryam (of) Säglat, which was donated to (St.) Mary by Wälättä Kidan so that it might be for her a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. He who stole it or erased (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul.
additional.det: Crudely written alternately in red and black ink.
The text is written in small-size letters, apparently in the same hand as the rest of the Ms.

additional.cont: Fol. 139rb: Scribe’s note on completing the writing.
additional.add: Fol. 139rb: ስብሐት፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፨ ዘአፈጸመኒ፡ በሰላም፡ ወለወ[ላ]ዲቱ፡ ድንግል፡ ማርያም፡ ቡርክት፨
additional.tran: [Fol. 139rb]: Praise be to God who has enabled me to complete (this writing) in peace, and to His Mother, the blessed Virgin Mary.

additional.cont: Fol. 139rb-va: Hymn Śärawitä mälaˀǝktihu lä-mädḫane ˁaläm „The hosts of the angels of the Saviour of the world“ written out for various liturgical occasions.

additional.det: Except for the first few letters, the text of the note has been erased.

additional.cont: Fols. 139vb-140va: Prayer after the Eucharist (?).
additional.add: Incipit (fol. 139vb): እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላክነ፡ ዘይነብር፡ ዲበ፡ መላእክት፡ ዘመልልዕት፡ ወሊቃነ፡ መላእክት፡ አጋዕዝት፡ ሥልጣናት፡ ኪሩቤል፡ ወሱራፌል፡ ዘውእቱ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ኵሉ፡ ፍጥረት፡... Explicit (fol. 140va): ...እለ፡ ገነዝዎ፡ ለሥጋከ፡ ወረከቡ፡ በህየ፡ ናህየ፡ ወዕረፍተ፡ ወክብረ፡ እምኀበ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ይዕዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

extras.extra: Crude notes and drawings of lines, in ink of different colours: fol. 1r. Crude notes: fols. 1v, 2v. A text written in red and black ink, possibly an Additio, has been fully erased: fol. 2v. Crude notes in the bottom margin: fols. 62r, 71r, 72r, etc. Notes in the upper margin, in red ink. Some of them refer to the texts beginning on respective pages while others indicate liturgical occasions on which particular Anaphoras are to be celebrated: fols. 65v, 74v, 83r, 88r, 90v, 96r, 101v, 107r, 114r, 115v, 124r, 131v, 137r, Crude note in the upper margin, in dark green ink: fol. 101v. Crude drawings of (apparently meaningless) lines: fol. 140v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Threads are inserted in the upper outer corners of fols. 26, 27, 46, 53, 74, for navigation in the text.

drawing.details: crude drawings of three human-like figures, one of them possibly an angel armed with a sword. Caption beside the drawings reads: አነ፡ ቀስ፡ ገብረ፡ መድህን። It is unclear to which of the figures the caption refers

frames.frame: 1) Crudely drawn black ornamental band with geometric ornamentation motifs, under the text of Additio 4: fol. 2v. 2) Two coloured (red, black) ornamental bands over cols. a-b, at the incipit of text I: fol. 3r. 3) Coloured (red, black) ornamental band with interlaces, at the incipit of text II: fol. 20va.
